toolingEntityParticle.InlineHelpText:
Set from Product Group. Valid Product Types are

Stock
Configured
Kit
Service
Miscellaneous
Entitlement
Recurring Service
toolingEntityParticle.Label: Product Type
toolingEntityParticle.Name: rstk__soprod_prodtype__c
toolingEntityParticle.Metadata: <CustomField xmlns="http://soap.sforce.com/2006/04/metadata" > <fullName>rstk__soprod__c.rstk__soprod_prodtype__c</fullName> <caseSensitive>false</caseSensitive> <deprecated>false</deprecated> <description>Stock–Product has 1 inventory component that is itself. Product Number (SOPROD_PROD) is same as the Inventory Item (ICITEM_ITEM)Configured–The Product Number is the same as the Inventory Item. However, configured products have multiple components & are tied to a WO that is used to build the item specifically for the SO Line. Components for the configured product can come from the standard Engineering BOM, or be defined in a table subordinate to the Product (see SOCOMM_USEPRODCOMPS).Kit–The Kitted product parent (Product Number) is itself not an inventory item, but represents a set of items that are to be shipped together. The set of items is defined on the Product Component table.Service–Service Products are used to sell one or more services (no inventory). While similar to miscellaneous products, a mechanism is provided to record the details of when services are provided, & by whom.Miscellaneous–These are any non-inventory products consisting of 1 or many component parts. (DD)</description> <escapeMarkup>false</escapeMarkup> <externalId>false</externalId> <inlineHelpText>Set from Product Group.
